DataElement.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Severity/Intensity Scale for Adverse Events Severity Grade Text java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The description of the adverse events, from the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), used in reporting adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Severity/Intensity Scale for Adverse Events Severity Grade Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.:A scale that defines the degree or state of disease existing in a patient as a result of the occurrence of an adverse event.:Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality._The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Severity/Intensity Scale for Adverse Events Severity Grade
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.:A scale that defines the degree or state of disease existing in a patient as a result of the occurrence of an adverse event.:Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.
A scale that defines the degree or state of disease existing in a patient as a result of the occurrence of an adverse event.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
